metadata.Description: The concept that data is subject to the laws and governance of the country in which it is collected, stored, and processed.

data sovereignty.Description: Data sovereignty implements data protection regulations to ensure the privacy and security of data.
Data sovereignty funds data localization initiatives to promote local storage and processing of data.
Data sovereignty focuses on data governance to establish rules and policies for data management.
Data sovereignty is embedded in national legislation to assert control over data within a country's borders.
Data sovereignty partners with cybersecurity agencies to enhance data protection and prevent cyber threats.
Data sovereignty contributes to digital sovereignty by ensuring control and ownership of data within a country.
Data sovereignty monitors data flows to ensure compliance with data protection regulations and prevent unauthorized transfers.
Data sovereignty targets cross-border data transfers to regulate the movement of data across national borders.
Data sovereignty addresses data privacy concerns by establishing regulations and safeguards for personal data.
